definition: strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)

sentences.english: Who is this king, but a king of air?
sentences.chinese: 哪一個君王不過是外強中乾的空架子？

sentences.english: But I am "outwardly strong and inwardly weak".
sentences.chinese: 可是我覺得我現在是“外強中乾”。

sentences.english: Is Iran really dangerous, or is it just a paper tiger?
sentences.chinese: 伊朗真的會造成威脅，抑或只是外強中乾？

definition: extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
to whisper to one another's ear
